definition: to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)

sentences.english: Not enough cooling power could mean heatstroke or dehydration.
sentences.chinese: 冷卻能力不足會造成中暑脫水。

sentences.english: Sometimes a person stops sweating when heatstroke hits.
sentences.chinese: 有時候，發生中暑時，患者會停止出汗。
夏今防中暑，荷葉同粥煮。

sentences.english: Kudzu root soup is used to prevent heat stroke and influencer in summer time, when temperature is very high.
sentences.chinese: 酷熱天氣下，飲用粉葛湯可預防中暑以及感冒。

sentences.english: The weather was so hot that she got sunstroke.
sentences.chinese: 天氣太熱，以致她中暑了。

sentences.english: Heat stroke is a life-threatening illness.
sentences.chinese: 中暑是危及生命的嚴重疾病。

sentences.english: Why I often am met collywobbles , still often giddy, be to suffer heatstroke?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼我老是會肚子疼，還經常頭暈，是中暑了嗎？

sentences.english: Objective To analyze clinical experience in treatment of heatstroke.
sentences.chinese: 目的總結分析治療中暑的臨牀經驗。

sentences.english: One of the guests was treated for sunstroke.
sentences.chinese: 一個客人因爲中暑而接受了治療。

sentences.english: With what medicine is summertime heatstroke cold good?
sentences.chinese: 夏季中暑感冒用什麼藥好呢？

sentences.english: As they marched, a few got sunstroke and dropped out.
sentences.chinese: 行進途中有幾個人中暑退出了。
吐血，鼻子流血是中暑嗎？

sentences.english: One who works under the hot sun is liable to sunstroke.
sentences.chinese: 在炎熱的陽光底下工作很容易引起中暑。

sentences.english: In scorching heat, some people have died of sunstroke and dehydration.
sentences.chinese: 炙熱的高溫使有些人因中暑脫水而死亡。

sentences.english: Don't mention it, I have had heatstroke for several times.
sentences.chinese: 別提了，我都中暑好幾次了。

definition: to catch cold/(common) cold/CL:場|场[chang2],次[ci4]/(coll.) to be interested in (often used in the negative)/(Tw) to detest/can't stand
to faint/to swoon/to black out/to become unconscious
to get wet in the rain
